meanings.definition: Containing nothing; not filled or occupied.
meanings.sent1: The room was empty of furniture.
meanings.sent2: The glass was empty after I drank all the water.
meanings.sent3: The empty cookie jar made me sad.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were empty of emotion.
meanings.sent5: The empty playground echoed with silence.

meanings.sent1: His speech was empty of any real content.
meanings.sent2: The promise turned out to be empty and false.
meanings.sent3: The empty excuse did not fool anyone.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed empty, hiding her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The empty words left us feeling unsatisfied.

meanings.sent1: Please empty the trash bin before it overflows.
meanings.sent2: I need to empty my backpack of all the old papers.
meanings.sent3: He decided to empty his mind of worries and just relax.
meanings.sent4: The magician seemed to empty the hat of endless scarves.
meanings.sent5: She had to empty her pockets before going through security.
